result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrell Deandrae Stovall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/01/2016 or penalty of 5 days Huber for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jarrell Deandrae Stovall in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #2 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2 with the repeater struck.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $505.00
DNA previously done
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/2016.  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 5 days in Huber
dated Feb 17, 2016,   Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff, from Atty Hirt
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Defendant Jarrell Deandrae Stovall in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court schedules case, then reschedules it to the same date as the co-defendant.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jarrell Deandrae Stovall in court with attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Additional discovery has been requested.  Next hearing is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant/Woodman's listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Jarrell Deandrae Stovall in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for attorney Tedia K. Gamino.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
